answers.answer: Just relax it's nothing you can do is to relax and take it a day at a time & continue to eat healthy...It's all going to be ok
Im home last 3 days resting,my BP is under 140/90 with medicamentation.I will have another urine test on wendesday to see if there is a difference.And trying to take proteins as much as possible.

I delivered my first son at 34 weeks.  I also had preeclampsia.  I had over 6 grams of protein in my urine. My son weighed 4 pounds an 14 oz an he was great. No feeding tubes or breathing tubes. He did how ever have to stay in the hospital for 8 days because he was jaundice. He is now 5 soon to be 6 an doin great. Hope this helps. N brings some positivity.
Thank you so much for sharing your experience, i really need it.

Your welcome,  hoped it helped. Once I had my son everything reversed it self only I ended up havin high blood pressure for 2 month an then that to went away. Hope everything goes well for you. N good luck.

I had my son at 36 weeks and 3 days and I also suffered from preeclampsia. However mine came all of the sudden, I went in for my first weekly appointment and my BP was too high, they made me stay and lay on my side for about 15 minutes, took my pressure again and it was still high. Had me pee on the cup and then lay on my left side again for another 15 minutes and no change. Since I had my appointment on a Friday they made me collect my pee for 24 hours and had me go back on Monday to turn it in so they could test it for make sure it was preeclampsia, the doctor also prescribe medication over the weekend to help. So I went back Monday to turn it in and then again my pressure was through the roof, and they made me do the whole resting on my sides and all that. Oh, I forgot to mention that she also basically put me on bed rest for that weekend, which was really hard for me to do with my then four year all and all the stuff that I usually do during the weekend, like cleaning and all that good stuff lol. So to make this long story short, I went into labour the next day on Tuesday early in the morning. My son was born weighing at 4 lbs 13 oz, he didn't need spacial care, he passed all the tests that they do on them like sugar, jaundice and even the car seat test, because they thought he might be way to small for a regular infant car seat. He did awesome, we stayed at the hospital for two days due to my BP and also that he lost 5oz and were a little worried about that. On last thing, when the ob came to check up on us the next day after having my son, she told me that in fact it was preeclampsia and that they were going to induce me the Thursday of that same week because of it. I'm glad my son and my body decided to just go ahead and do it all in its own. I hope this helps. Hang in there and try to relax as much as you can do you can at least make it 2 more weeks or longer to make sure the little one can go home along with you ;). You'll be amazed how strong they are even of they look so fragile. God bless you and your bundle of joy!

Oh once last thing, I too had high bloop pressure after the deliver and was on medication for about a month. Now I'm pregnant with my third and last and I'm more prone to having preeclampsia earlier with this pregnancy since I had it with my previous but I'm just trying not to stress a lot and eat healthy and I also drink tons of water. :(

I had preeclampsia with 2 of my 3 and I only had issues with my first which were not that major. I was induced on my due date due to high blood pressure and was kept in the hospital 7 days after she was born because my blood pressure wouldn't go down.

My baby is not as active as before, and im concern because she doesnt get enough nutritient from me(because of preeclampsia)How was your babies who had the same problem, are they(did they) active all the time?

For preeclampsia lower your sodium intake to less than 1000 mg per day, load up on water and REST. Like as in complete bed rest. I had my first at 32 weeks because of preeclampsia and my 2nd at 37 weeks. With my first we both nearly died, especially me. I fought for my life in a hospital bed for 2 weeks. That was 11 years ago and my daughter is healthy now.... yes, we are alive, although it was not an easy or pretty ordeal. Low sodium and relax, ask your doc what else you can do to slow the preeclampsia, sometimes blood pressure meds can help.

Did you have a high preeclampsia like with headache,vomiting etc.I dont even feel different, my BP is reaching to 140/90 thats why im using medicamentations and protein in my urine.The rest i dont have any sympthoms.

question: Is there any sucessfull stories for motivation, im 34 weeks and baby grows 2 weeks later(her size and weigh as 32 weeks)What i should do,any suggestion?
title: preeclampsia
